## Learning objectives
Course Learning Objectives: By the end of the course, you should be able to

- Understand the scope and development of biomechanics.
- Understand the concepts of continuum mechanics.
- Learn the equilibrium equations and constitutive relations in biosolid mechanics.
- Learn the applications of biomechanics to hard tissues.
- Learn the applications of biomechanics to soft tissues.
 
## Course format 
- Lectures on the fundamentals of Biomechanics-I 
- In-class problems
- Homework
- Interactive quizzes and instant concept checks
- Two exams (Midterm and Final) 

## Audience and credit-level
The course is designed for junior-level undergraduate students as a 3-credit course. 

## Prerequisites
[APSC 2057](https://bulletin.gwu.edu/courses/apsc/) and [CE 2220](https://bulletin.gwu.edu/courses/ce/).

## Workload
This course will have 150 minutes of lecture time per week, that includes approximately 60-75 minutes of hands-on, microlab work. The course requires between 2-4 hours per week on average for homework assignments or project-based deliverables.
